paper_abstract: We enlighten the differences between one-dimensional and two-dimensional cellular automata by considering both the dynamical and decidability aspects. We also show a canonical representation theorem for the slicing constructions, a tool allowing to give the 2D version of important 1D CA notions as closing and positive expansivity and lift 1D results to the 2D settings.
paper_title: From One-dimensional to Two-dimensional Cellular Automata
